*Compassion, Dignity, and Heartfelt Support – That’s the LDV Promise*  

  

**Who We Are:**  

Luna Del Valle Hospice is a locally operated, nurse\\-owned hospice provider serving families throughout New Mexico. Headquartered in Albuquerque, our mission extends to rural communities like Gallup, where we deliver holistic, person\\-focused care to those navigating life’s final journey.  

  

We believe that hospice is more than medical support—it’s about being present, attentive, and compassionate during life’s most meaningful moments. We’re looking for a **Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN)** who is ready to provide this level of care in a part\\-time capacity.  

  

**Role Overview:**  

The **LPN** will provide in\\-home nursing care to patients under the supervision of a Registered Nurse. You will be part of an interdisciplinary team dedicated to ensuring comfort, quality of life, and dignity for every patient and their family.  

  

**Your Key Responsibilities Will Include:**  

  

Administering medications and treatments following hospice protocols and nursing standards  

* 
Performing essential clinical tasks within the scope of LPN practice  
* 
Monitoring changes in patient condition and notifying the RN as needed  
* 
Contributing to the development and revision of care plans with measurable outcomes  
* 
Maintaining complete and timely documentation of all care activities  
* 
Offering emotional support to patients and loved ones  
* 
Participating in care coordination meetings and collaborating with the broader care team  
* 
Encouraging teamwork by supporting other staff as needed  
* 

**Ideal Candidate Qualities:**  

  

Graduate of an accredited LPN or LVN program  

* 
Holds an active LPN license in the State of New Mexico  
* 
CPR certification required  
* 
Possesses a valid driver’s license and auto insurance  
* 
Minimum of 1 year of nursing experience (hospice experience is a plus)  
* 
Strong interpersonal and organizational skills  
* 
A compassionate, professional approach to patient care  
* 
Comfortable with basic math and medication administration procedures  
* 

**Additional Expectations:**  

  

Respects all patient privacy and HIPAA guidelines  

* 
Stays current with continuing education and required training  
* 
Follows applicable healthcare regulations and best practices  
* 
May be included in an occasional on\\-call rotation  
* 

**Why Choose Luna Del Valle Hospice?**  

  

A welcoming and low\\-pressure team atmosphere  

* 
Opportunities to develop expertise in hospice and palliative care  
* 
Flexible part\\-time scheduling  
* 
Most evenings and weekends off (unless otherwise requested)  
* 
The chance to make a real difference for individuals and families in your community  
* 

**Apply Today**  

Bring your nursing skills and heart for service to a team that values integrity, empathy, and personalized care.  

 Visit www.ldvhospice.com to learn more or submit your resume now.

title: Registered Nurse - Los Lunas/Belen and surrounding areas
description:
**Benefits:**  

* 401(k)
* Competitive salary
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

  

**Job Summary**  

  

A Home Healthcare Registered Nurse is responsible for delivering high\\-quality nursing care to patients in their homes. This role includes performing skilled nursing visits, managing patient care plans, monitoring patient health, educating patients and caregivers, and working closely with interdisciplinary healthcare teams to ensure the best outcomes.  

  

The nurse must be able to assess a variety of medical conditions, provide compassionate care, and support the patient’s independence and quality of life. Home Healthcare Nurses must be self\\-directed, organized, and comfortable working independently while representing the agency with professionalism and empathy.  

  

  

**Responsibilities Include:**  

  

* Coordinate with other colleagues to assess, plan, implement, or evaluate patient care plans
* Administer medications and monitor patients for side effects or reactions
* Document any changes in patient conditions and report on changes
* Maintain accurate records of patient care and discuss observations with the supervisor
* Conducting in\\-home patient assessments and skilled nursing visits
* Creating and updating individualized care plans
* Collaborating with physicians, therapists, and caregivers
* Educating patients and families on health management

Ensuring compliance with all clinical and safety standards  
* 

**Requirements:**  

  

* Currently licensed Registered Nurse (RN) in state of employment
* Previous experience as a Registered Nurse is preferred
* Excellent interpersonal and client care skills
* Valid driver’s license
* First aid/CPR certification required

**Why Join Roadrunner?**  

  

* Patient\\-centered care model
* Supportive leadership \\& training
* Be part of a team that cares deeply about our community

title: HOME HEALTH REGISTERED NURSE
description:
**Job Title:** Home Health Admission RN Nurse  

**Location:** Lawrence/Methuen/Haverhill/Andover  

**Job Type:** Full time/Part\\-Time  

**Reports To:** Director of Nursing / Clinical Supervisor  

  

**Position Summary:**  

  

We are seeking a compassionate, detail\\-oriented, and experienced **Registered Nurse (RN)** to join our home health team as an **Admission Nurse**. The Admission RN is responsible for conducting initial assessments of new patients, initiating the plan of care, and ensuring all documentation and compliance requirements are met. This role is critical in setting the foundation for the patient’s home health care experience and achieving optimal clinical outcomes.  

  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

  

Conduct comprehensive nursing assessments in the patient’s home environment, including physical, functional, psychosocial, and environmental evaluations.  

* 
Initiate the Plan of Care (POC) and complete the OASIS Start of Care (SOC) documentation accurately and timely in accordance with agency policies and CMS guidelines.  
* 
Collaborate with the interdisciplinary team, including physicians, therapists, and home health aides, to ensure coordinated and effective patient care.  
* 
Educate patients and caregivers on disease processes, medications, safety, and the home health plan of care.  
* 
Identify patient needs and make appropriate referrals for additional services such as PT, OT, MSW, and HHA.  
* 
Verify and reconcile medications during the initial visit.  
* 
Communicate and report patient status and any changes in condition to the physician and clinical team promptly.  
* 
Maintain compliance with all federal, state, and local regulations, as well as agency policies and procedures.  
* 
Provide skilled nursing services as needed during the SOC visit.  
* 

**Qualifications:**  

  

* **Licensed Registered Nurse (RN)** in the state of Massachusetts.
* Minimum of **1–2 years of clinical nursing experience**, preferably in home health, acute care, or skilled nursing.
* Proficiency with **OASIS documentation** and electronic medical record (EMR) systems (e.g., Finale, Axxess, WellSky, HCHB, etc.).
Strong clinical judgment, critical thinking, and organizational skills.  
* 
Ability to work independently and manage time effectively.  
* 
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.  
* 
Reliable transportation and valid driver’s license.  
* 

**Preferred Qualifications:**  

  

* Prior experience as an **admission nurse** in a Medicare\\-certified home health agency.
Knowledge of CMS regulations and conditions of participation.  
* 
Bilingual skills are a plus.  
* 

**Working Conditions:**  

  

Patient homes and community settings.  

* 
Must be able to travel to patient homes within assigned territory.  
* 

**Join our compassionate and dedicated team of professionals committed to providing high\\-quality home health care and making a meaningful difference in patients' lives.**  

Flexible work from home options available.

title: Home Health RN Case Manager
description:
**Benefits:**  

* 401(k)
* Company car
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance

  

Amcare Pro Home Health is a mid\\-size home health care company with offices in East Texas and Dallas. The Dallas office is a stable operation \\& census; including a well\\-seasoned office and field staff. We are currently interviewing for a **Part** **Time/PRN (transition to Full Time upon eligibility) Home Health RN Case Manager** position**.**  

  

The position will involve home care visits for Admits, Recerts, Sup \\& SN visits. Previous Home Health Care experience is a must. Familiarity with electronic charting (KINNSER/AXXESS) is a plus.  

  

**Job Details**  

  

The RN position will be required to perform home health SN Initial Assessments, OASIS Admissions, Re\\-cert visits, ensure compliance with all State regulations. The RN must have knowledge/experience with home health forms, OASIS charting, Medicare guidelines, rules \\& regulations.  

  

**Qualifications**  

  

1\\. Must currently be licensed in the state of Texas  

2\\. Should have at least 2 year nursing experience  

3\\. IV infusion experience is a MUST  

4\\. Prior home health care experience is a MUST  

5\\. Should have Reliable Transportation \\& Car insurance  

6\\. Must be able to pass background check \\& have valid CPR  

7\\. Experience with Oasis E is a plus  

8\\. Knowledge of ICD\\-10 codes is a plus  

9\\. Excellent compensation with benefits  

  

If interested, please respond to this posting with a current resume and cover letter for further consideration.

title: Senior Clinical Doc Specialist - 12343
description:
**Location:** Larkin Bldg @ Exchange Street
  

**Location of Job** : US:NY:Buffalo
  

**Work Type** : Full\\-Time
  

**Shift 1**

#### **Job Description**Promote an accurate and meaningful database that clearly demonstrates the resources used in the patient's care. Act as an essential resource to the clinical team and collaborates extensively with Physicians/Providers, HIM coding team, Nursing, Patient Management, Quality Department and ancillary staff to perform concurrent analytical review of clinical documentation and coding data. Facilitates obtaining appropriate clinical documentation for any clinical conditions or procedures to support the appropriate severity of illness, expected risk of mortality, and complexity of care of the patient. The goal is to improve documentation of all conditions and treatments from point of entry to discharge,ensuring an accurate reflection of the patient condition in the associated DRG assignments, case\\-mix index, documentation/coded quality metrics, and reimbursement. Exhibits a sufficient knowledge of clinical documentation requirements, DRG assignment, and clinical conditions and/or procedures. Educate members of the patient care team regarding clinical documentation guidelines and impact, including attending Physicians, Advanced care practitioners, Residents/Medical students, Business Advisor's and other members of the health care team. Also responsible for audit review to identify potential documentation deficiencies in specific records and to identify clinical specialties that require focused interaction and physician/provider education. In addition, leads all service line provider engagement, relationship establishment and oversees ongoing documentation improvement initiatives including formal and informal education related to clinical documentation improvement to providers and the team. Oversees the general departmental orientation and development of new team members. Assist management in the generation and maintenance of analytic reports on routine basis and as needed. Responsible for additional assignments that require leadership abilities.

#### **Education And Credentials**

Bachelors degree required. Registered Nurse required. Cert. Clinical Doc Specialist (CCS) required


#### **Experience**5 years of experience in Patient Management, acute care, medical/surgical or ICU/ED as a licensed Registered Nurse required. 5 years of experience in Clinical Documentation Specialist field, coding classifications systems such as, but not limited to, ICD\\- CM, AP\\-DRG, APR \\-DRG, MS\\-DRG required. Essential:

company_description: Kaleida Health is the largest healthcare provider in Western New York, serving the area's eight counties with state-of-the-art technology and comprehensive healthcare services.
